testsuite.name: au.edu.uq.smartass.question.AreaOfTriangleModuleTest
testsuite.system-out: Let $A(1,1,1)$, $B(4,5,6)$ and $C(2,1,3)$ be the three vertices of a triangle. Determine the area of $\triangle ABC$. $\frac{\sqrt{81.0}}{2}$ units$^2$ \begin{align*} \text{Area}&=\frac{1}{2}|\vec{AB}\times\vec{AC}|\\ \vec{AB}&=(3,4,5)\\ \vec{AC}&=(1,0,2)\\\\ \vec{AB}\times\vec{AC}&=\left|\begin{array}{crc}\textbf{i}&\textbf{j}&\textbf{k}\\3&4&5\\1&0&2\end{array}\right|\\ &=\textbf{i}\left|\begin{array}{rc}4&5\\0&2\end{array}\right|-\textbf{j}\left|\begin{array}{cc}3&5\\1&2\end{array}\right|+\textbf{k}\left|\begin{array}{cr}3&4\\1&0\end{array} \right|\\ &=8\textbf{i}-1\textbf{j}-4\textbf{k}\\\\ |\vec{AB}\times\vec{AC}|&=\sqrt{8^2+1^2+4^2}\\ &=\sqrt{81.0}\\\\ \text{Therefore area }&=\frac{1}{2}\times\sqrt{81.0}\\ &=\frac{\sqrt{81.0}}{2}\text{ units}^2\\ \end{align*}
